column11: notes
coverage quite low, but reads consistently up in cryptic
seddighi - event looks real but v lowly expressed. Very clean in humphrey i3
Overlapping transcripts on annotation. bleedthrough mixed with longer tx. Appears more likely to be IR. Unlikely IR in seddighi i3s (looks like real last exon) but not differentially regulated
Definitely IR mixed with last exon. But actual event called as cryptic is long extension, which doesn't appear cryptic and corresponds to most of retained intron
intron retention, very lowly expressed isoform overall. coverage does drop in intron so could be real, but unlikely given depth
intron retention. Also lowly expressed
intron retention
intron retention, ribo-seq reads over junction
looks like real 3'UTR, but unclear whether cryptic from coverage trace. Unlikely cryptic in Humphrey i3s
reads in cryptic also downstream of stops in any frame
genuine bleedthrough, not particularly cryptic looking though
intron retention (annotated). overall translation up in KD
very lowly expressed
lncRNA. Looks real but lowly expressed
upreglated but cassette exon extension not last
definitely upregulated but also basal IR. Event looks real but unchanged in humphrey i3s
genuine event but not cryptic (overlapping txs but judging by SJ)
intron retention (annotated), total RNA goes down
expressed in ctls but likely cryptic by ratio (just)
intron retention (annotated)
intron retention (annotated). Possibly also bleedthrough as coverage drops a bit downstream in seddighi i3, but not convincing in humphrey i3s
expression in ctls, likely cryptic by ratio (expression seems to go down). low ribo-seq coverage
lowly included. Whole exon is cryptic (novel SJ)
intron retention. Present in CTL & KD (likely cryptic because other utr downregulated - independent transcripts?)
extension of ALE
IR from upstream exon through to bleedthrough

riboseq coverage v low. Event definitely cryptic (extension of annotated internal last exon). Unusual basal IR at 3'end of overlapping intron in seddighi i3s & humphrey i3s, but discontinuous coverage over intron body
very clean, obvious downreg of RNA downstream. no ribo-seq reads at all
cryptic CDS terminates 1 codon downstream of SJ
RNAseq coverage very low, doesn't look cryptic
likely to be IR (drop in cov downstream of end but similar coverage at ends of introns. Looks more IR-like in humphrey i3s
annotated, also low level basal IR
